name: Screensize widthDetector
body: ### screen size issue: When we are connecting to the server, the server doesn't know about the device we are using, on a Responsive project it is very important to deliver the RWD Media optimised for different devices. How to solve this problem? ### DEMO (Resize to play ) http://leolanese.com/widthdetector/ ### widthDetector is an easy way to detect the viewport size of your device: widthDetect is a simple js library to @media target your grid design. It works cross-browser, cross-device, cross-library and is less than 1KB! ### How to do it: Event listeners: This script is fired on resize() for testing proposes and rotate() for rotation proposes. JS debound: Because we don't want to make a battery of request I'm debounding and temporarily stopping request. ### What else you need to do: This is the client side. The server needs to deliver the image depending on the RWD break points, like: [0,250] = 1 image 250px and then use it max-width:100% I already created several RWD break points, but you should have 2 or 3, like: Small, Medium and Large. ### On the server side. How to do it: ##SiteCore example: http://sdn.sitecore.net/Articles/XSL/5%203%20Enhancements/Image%20Enhancements.aspx ##Sencha example: http://www.sencha.com/learn/how-to-use-src-sencha-io/ ##Custom: Or we can manually implement it. If that the case, remember to cache. ### License MIT license ### Support or Contact Having trouble with Pages? @leolaneseltd and weâ€™ll help you sort it out asap.
